Specific Details: IWA met with Billy Kelleher & Margaret Murphy O' Mahony to discuss issues relating to accessible transport Every year significant contracts are awarded by the state to taxi companies. i.	IWA would like to see a situation whereby companies who have accessible taxis are considered to be more suitable to be awarded contracts than companies with no accessible vehicles.  ii.	Discussed arranging a meeting with Minister Ross & Minister Eoghan Murphy
DPOs Lobbied: Billy Kelleher|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Margaret Murphy O'Mahony|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: IWA met with Billy Kelleher & Margaret Murphy O' Mahony to discuss issues relating to accessible transport Every year significant contracts are awarded by the state to taxi companies. i.	IWA would like to see a situation whereby companies who have accessible taxis are considered to be more suitable to be awarded contracts than companies with no accessible vehicles.  ii.	Discussed arranging a meeting with Minister Ross & Minister Eoghan Murphy
Intended Results: For Billy Kelleher & Margaret Murphy O' Mahony to make representation on behalf of Irish Wheelchair Association to Minister for Transport in relation to contracts with Taxi companies
Lobbying Activities: This meeting was held in IWA head quarters in Leinster House|Meeting|1

Specific Details: Reforms to the disability sector including introduction of personal budgets
DPOs Lobbied: Margaret Murphy O'Mahony|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Reforms to the disability sector including introduction of personal budgets
Intended Results: Support for a number of urgently needed key reforms in the disability sector including the Government promise to establish a taskforce to look into establishment of personal budgets for people with disabilities within three months.::Support for other areas of work including speech and language therapy services, establishing a commission on the cost of disability and the introduction of disability hate crime.
Lobbying Activities: This meeting took place in Leinster House, Kildare Street, Dublin 2. The agenda consisted of discussion around the contents of Inclusion Ireland's General Election Manifesto 'A Disability Manifesto for Equality & Human Rights' that includes sections on the following: Advocacy Supports, Therapy Services, Access to Early Childhood Education, Inclusive Education Supports, Life-Long Education and Training, Direct Payments, Cost of Disability, Assisted Decision-Making Supports and Disability Hate Crime and urgent reforms that are needed in the disability sector including the introduction of personal budgets for people with disabilities.|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Communications & Information Officer Cormac Cahill and CEO Paddy Connolly.

DPOs Lobbied: Michael Creed|Minister|Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine::Margaret Murphy O'Mahony|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Intended Results: Seeking assistance with highlighting the issues

DPOs Lobbied: Margaret Murphy O'Mahony|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Caoimhghín Ó Caoláin|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Intended Results: Asking Parliamentary Question (PQ) of the Minister for Health Simon Harris on the topic of funding for the implementation of the Assisted Decision-Making Act.::To ask the Minister for Health what budget has been allocated for the effective implementation of the Assisted Decision-Making Act and in particular whether resources will be made available for the recruitment of the Director of the Decision Support Service to fulfill his or her function.

Specific Details: The Framework Agreement on Medicine Pricing
DPOs Lobbied: Billy Kelleher|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Michael McGrath|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Michael Harty|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Margaret Murphy O'Mahony|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: The Framework Agreement on Medicine Pricing
Intended Results: To ensure that process for access to new medicines was improved
Lobbying Activities: The purpose of the meetings was to update the politicians on the considerable savings that have been achieved as a result of the medicine pricing agreement and inform them that despite the savings achieved, an uncertainty still exists around the reimbursement timelines and funding for new and innovative medicines.|Meeting|2-5

Specific Details: The General Scheme of the Assisted Human Reproduction Bill 2017.
DPOs Lobbied: Michael Harty|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Bernard Durkan|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Margaret Murphy O'Mahony|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: The General Scheme of the Assisted Human Reproduction Bill 2017.
Intended Results: To persuade Committee members to reject the proposals of this bill. Specifically, 1) the funding of IVF; 2) embryo experimentation; 3) stating in law that the birth / surrogate mother and not the genetic mother is the child's mother.
Lobbying Activities: Supporters were urged to contact three of seven TDs serving on the Select Health Committee asking them to reject the proposals of the Bill in question.|Email|2-5
Grassroots directive: To urge them to contact 3 named Committee TDs to reject the Bill proposals.

Subject Matter: Recruitment and Retention crisis in nursing and midwifery professions.
Intended Results: To persuade TDs that there is a link between pay and the recruitment and retention difficulties of the professions.
Lobbying Activities: 27  and 31st August 2018 - Presented detailed information to supplement discussion.|Meeting|2-5
